column4: if was to buy a new computer in the next few months, where should i look that would be a great system for dual booting?
a year old machine is better
how come a year old machine, my refurbished dell laptop has been a big problem with drivers
a year old, to give the free guys a chance at it.
would linux be able to utilize dual graphics cards?
i don't think they have the dual pci-e (terminology?) for nvidia working, but who can without support from the manufactureres?
but xinerama has a working technique
a means of combining multiple cards/monitors onto a unifed desktop
it's worked in my previous installs. I don't have that exact hardware in front of me, so I won't say it works now, except it has worked
this machine will be running breezy for a year yet, I expect to hear that same question close to a year from now :)\
but isn't part of using linux tinkering it and updating and stuff
well, there's another take: makde this damn machine work, and do it's job well. Who cares what version of software, as long as it's secure & does the job
ahh now my video's don't show up, just audio
